item.description:
If you can't make it to the Wednesday evening paddle here is an great opportunity to enjoy the wonderful paddling location of Seabrook / Hampton Harbor & Estuaries. This paddle is open to all levels as there are paddling options for all levels at this location.

High Tide is at 4:17pm so there will be plenty of water in the Harbor

We'll split into groups at the beach so if some want to go out and play in some surf or current you can do that. If others want to play in some gentler current at the Blackwater Bridge that is a really fun thing to do as well. Or if you just want to enjoy paddling the estuaries from Seabrook Harbor to Salisbury at a leisurely pace that is another great option. We'll all meet back at the put-in later and head over to Castaways Restaurant which is right at Seabrook Harbor and dine on the deck for dinner.

Meeting Location: Park in the large public lot next to Eastman's Seafoood Rt. 1A Seabrook - There is a rest room building there as well.

Directions Below

From the North: Take Rte. 95 South to Exit 2 "Exeter/Hampton Route 101". Go through toll, then follow signs for Hampton-Route 101 East. Take this to Hampton Beach. Take a right onto Rte. 1A heading South. Go over the bridge. Parking lot is 1/2 mile down on the right side.

From the South: Take Rte. 495 North to 95 North. Take Exit 60-Rte. 286 Salisbury Beaches. Follow Rte. 286 East to its end at the beach. At the lights, take a left onto Rte 1A North. Drive 1 mile then through the next set of lights. Parking lot is on the left just past Eastman's Seafood.

Life vests must be worn when paddling with this group.

Click here for Google Maps directions to event location
item.name: Seabrook / Hampton Harbor & Estuaries Paddle
